labels.AR_APPROVAL_PATH_IN_USE_BY_RULES: The approval path is being used in a Requestor Group and cannot be deleted.
labels.grpUserFasterApproval: Group users for faster approvals - only one user in a group has to approve an order to satisfy the approval sequence.
labels.appCancelBeforeApproval: Allow Requestor to cancel request before final approval is made:
labels.setUpAGroupOfApprovers: Set up a group of approvers
labels.alertOnlyONeRule: Only one rule can be updated at a time.
labels.checkedItemLimit:
A checked item will limit the approver to view orders/invoices where the originating request was approved by this group.
;The approver must also have the permission 'My Invoices / My Orders' on.
labels.appCartTypeTools:
Use the tools below to create complex routing rules based on Cart Type, Currency Range or a Custom Routing List.
Set the evaluation order to tell the system which criteria to evaluate first.
labels.changesAreNotSavedAlert: Changes are not saved. Are you sure you want to switch the tab?
labels.AR_SUCCESSFULLY_REMOVED_ALL_REQUESTORS: Successfully removed all the requestors from the requestor group
labels.ERROR_NO_SHIPPING_OPT_SELECTED: Please select at least one shipping option
labels.ERROR_NO_PAYMENT_TYPE_SELECTED: Please select atleast one payment option
labels.errorUpdatingevaluationOrderMsg: The evaluation order must be a unique value of 1, 2 or 3. Please adjust your settings.
labels.SUCCESS_ROUTING_RULE_DELETED: Routing rules are successfully deleted. RuleId: 22928
labels.AR_INVALID_DELETE_REQUEST: Approval path delete process was failed - Invalid pathId/WebgroupId
labels.pathTools: Use the tools below to add users and adjust the order of this Approval Path. You must have at least one approver in the Approval Path.
labels.appSendAppRequestor: Send to both Approver and requestor
labels.rulesDescription: Create Routes and Rules for a customized approval experience. A Route is made up of one or more rules and can be created using SmartTrackers Lists or without.
labels.alertReqRejectionShouldBeUnique: Requisition Rejection types should be unique per web group
labels.LastNameUserNameEmail: First/Last Name, User Name or Email
labels.AR_PATH_APPROVERS_PENDING_AND_OPEN_REQUI: The approver(s) cannot be removed when open/pending requisitions exists requiring their approvel.
labels.hlpimg6: A default approval path must be selected for each Requestor Group.  The default approval path is used when there are no routing rules associated to the Requestor Group or when complex routing rules exists and an order does not fall into one of the identified rules.  For example,if a complex rule exists to route all requests over $5,000,yet no rule exists for requests less than $5,000,the deafult approver path will be used for all requests under $5,000.
labels.hlpimg5:
Allow approvers who also have the "Edit Requisitions" permission enabled to edit certain areas of the request.
  • Edit Shipping Address - The list of shipping addresses are based upon the approver,not the requestor
  • Edit Billing Address - The list of billing addresses are based upon the approver,not the requestor
  • Edit Shipping Carrier - The list of shipping carriers are based upon the approver,not the requestor group.
  • Edit Payment Method - The list of payment methods are based upon the approver,not the requestor group.
  • Edit PO / PO Release No. - Allow an approver to edit the PO number and PO Release.
labels.hlpimg4:
Send reminder emails when action is needed on a pending requisition.
You can choose to send a reminder to just the approver or both the requestor and approver as well as how often a reminder should be sent.
labels.AR_OVERLAP_RULE: Overlap rule: Please edit existing rule
labels.hlpimg3:
Set the communication level for requestors and approvers when any action is taken on the request,including submission,approval and order placement.
  • All- A communication is sent to the requestor and approver when any action is taken including submission of the request.the requestor will receive notification at every level of approval (first approver,second approver etc )
  • Final- A communication is sent to requestor when a request is submitted and upon final approval.Approvers continue to receive notification of pending requests.
  • Never - No requestor or approval emails are sent out under any circumstances.
labels.hlpimg2: Select the shipping options available to requestors when checking out using this Requestor group.
labels.hlpimg1: Select the payment options available to requestors when checking out using this Requestor group.
labels.errorEvalValueGreaterThan3: The evaluation order must be a unique value of 1, 2 or 3. Please adjust your settings.
labels.ERROR_EVALUATION_ORDER_VALUE_NOT_UNIQUE: The evaluation order must be a unique value of 1, 2 or 3. Please adjust your settings.
labels.alertPleaseEnterReqGroup: Please enter a Requestor Group Name
labels.appNoApproverNotes: No - approvers may approve in any order and the final approver may approve the requisition to an order at any time
labels.approversHavePendingReq: The selected approver(s) have open/pending requisitions requiring approval.
labels.AR_DUPLICATE_NAME: Approval path with this name already exist
labels.hlpimg9:
If Routing Rules exist,the system will use "Evaluation order" to rank cart features by level of importance. This will determine which rule should be executed first to determine approval routing.

Cart Type - referens to the items in the cart:
  • Standard: The cart contains all Approved Items as specified in the Approved Items custom catalog
  • Non Standard Cart: The cart contains at least one non-approved item that does not exist in the Approved items custom catalog
  • All Orders: Apply the rule to both Standard and Non-Standard carts

      • Currency Minimum - refers to the currency rules created within the routing rules.

      Custom Routing List - offers the ability to create a "list". For each list item,complex routing rules can be created.
labels.hlpimg8: Choose a SmartTracker list to use as your Custom Routing List for rules.
labels.hlpimg7:
Cart Type - refers to the items in the cart. A cart is identified as:
  • Standard: The cart contains all Approved Items as specified in the Approved Items custom catalog.
  • Non Standard Cart: The cart contains at least one non-approved item that does not exist in the Approved items custom catalog
  • All Orders: Apply the rule to both Standard and Non-Standard carts
labels.exportToExcel: Download Routes and Rules to Excel
labels.appSelectedOptions: Options included in this Requestor Group
labels.alertPayemntAndShippingOption: Please select at least one Payment Option and one Shipping Option
labels.hlpimg10:
Create one or more rules based on a currency range. The total is based on cart total (including shipping and tax fees).

For example,you could have one rule with a currency range of $0 - $499.99 routing to one approval path and a second rule with currency range of $500 - $999.99 routing to a different approval path.
labels.hlpimg11: Create a Custom Routing List (or select one from Smart Tracker) to show requestors within the checkout process. Once created or selected from smartTracker,rules can be built against each list selection.
labels.ERROR_NO_PAYMENT_AND_SHIPPING_OPT_SELECT: Please select atleast one payment and one shipping option

labels.approvalPathTip:
You can group users together for faster order approvals.
When users are grouped, only one user in the group has to approve an order to satisfy the approval sequence.
Use CTRL key or Mouse to select users.

labels.HelpTextForOrderPath: When utilizing multiple approvers and your requestor group enforces Approval Path, the Approval chain will follow the order to appearance in the list. The first Approver or group of Approvers will be at the top, indicated with a '1'. The last Approver or group of approvers will be at the bottom of the list.
